intro: Chaerophyllum sessiliflorum, commonly known as the sessile-flower hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
